attributes.action: Discard Non-Crime Hate Incident Laws pertaining to Social Media & Journalism.
attributes.additional_details: Discard the Non-Crime Hate Incident Law with regard to social media and journalism including articles, posts, comments and interactions. This is a law that many UK citizens do not support because of it’s ambiguous & subjective nature. There is public concern about  the potential of infringement on human rights with regards to freedom of speech, freedom of expression and the right to have a point of view which others may find offensive, but it not unlawful or a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Discard the Non-Crime Hate Incident Laws pertaining to social media & journalism. Rely on news & social media platform’s existing Public Safety Policies to deal with articles, posts, comments and interactions that are reported as offensive, hostile or prejudice to an individual, group or community.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition:

Abolish Non-Crime Hate Incidents: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/701051
